sentences.maori: I tētahi kāinga iti e noho ana i te takere o tētahi maunga nui, i reira tētahi tama ko Tama te ingoa.
sentences.english: In a small village at the base of a great mountain, there lived a boy named Tama.

notes.text: I tētahi kāinga iti

explanations.explanation: Indicates the place of an action.
Used to refer to a specific but unspecified thing.

notes.text: e noho ana i te takere o tētahi maunga nui
notes.translation: at the base of a great mountain

explanations.explanation: Indicates the place of an action.
Used to refer to a specific but unspecified thing.

notes.text: i reira tētahi tama ko Tama te ingoa
notes.translation: there lived a boy named Tama

explanations.explanation: Indicates the place of an action.
Used to refer to a specific but unspecified thing.
Particle used to introduce a name.

sentences.maori: Ko te maunga, ko Maunga Nui te ingoa, he tapu ki ngā tāngata o te kāinga.
sentences.english: The mountain, named Maunga Nui, was sacred to the people of the village.

notes.text: Ko te maunga

explanations.explanation: Particle used to introduce a subject.

notes.text: ko Maunga Nui te ingoa

explanations.explanation: Particle used to introduce a name.

notes.text: he tapu ki ngā tāngata o te kāinga
notes.translation: was sacred to the people of the village

sentences.maori: Ehara i te maunga noa iho, engari ko te tupuna o te whānau o Tama, e tiaki ana i a rātou, e hoatu ana i te kaha ki a rātou.
sentences.english: It was not just a mountain, but the ancestor of Tama's family, watching over them and giving them strength.

notes.text: Ehara i te maunga noa iho
notes.translation: It was not just a mountain

explanations.explanation: Indicates the object of the action.

notes.text: engari ko te tupuna o te whānau o Tama
notes.translation: but the ancestor of Tama's family

explanations.explanation: Particle used to introduce a subject.

notes.text: e tiaki ana i a rātou

explanations.explanation: Indicates the object of the action.

notes.text: e hoatu ana i te kaha ki a rātou

explanations.explanation: Indicates the object of the action.

sentences.maori: I mōhio ngā tāngata o te kāinga ko Maunga Nui tō rātou kaitiaki, ā, i whakaute rātou i tōna tapu.
sentences.english: The people of the village knew that Maunga Nui was their guardian, and they respected its sacredness.

notes.text: I mōhio ngā tāngata o te kāinga
notes.translation: The people of the village knew

notes.text: ko Maunga Nui tō rātou kaitiaki
notes.translation: that Maunga Nui was their guardian

explanations.explanation: Particle used to introduce a subject.

notes.text: ā, i whakaute rātou i tōna tapu

explanations.explanation: Indicates the object of the action.

sentences.maori: I whakapono rātou ko te wairua o te maunga e rere ana i roto i ō rātou toto, e hoatu ana i te māia me te māramatanga.
sentences.english: They believed that the spirit of the mountain flowed through their veins, giving them courage and wisdom.

notes.text: I whakapono rātou
ko te wairua o te maunga
notes.translation: that the spirit of the mountain

explanations.explanation: Particle used to introduce a subject.

notes.text: e rere ana i roto i ō rātou toto

explanations.explanation: Indicates the place of an action.

notes.text: e hoatu ana i te māia me te māramatanga

explanations.explanation: Indicates the object of the action.

sentences.maori: He maha ngā kōrero a te whānau o Tama mō te tiakitanga me te ārahitanga a Maunga Nui i ō rātou tūpuna.
sentences.english: Tama's family had many stories about the protection and guidance of Maunga Nui for their ancestors.

notes.text: He maha ngā kōrero
a te whānau o Tama
mō te tiakitanga me te ārahitanga a Maunga Nui
notes.translation: about the protection and guidance of Maunga Nui

notes.text: i ō rātou tūpuna

explanations.explanation: Indicates the object of the action.

sentences.maori: I tētahi rā, i rongo a Tama i te hononga hohonu ki a Maunga Nui, ā, i hiahia ia ki te rongo i tōna aroaro.
sentences.english: One day, Tama felt a deep connection to Maunga Nui and wanted to feel its presence.

notes.text: I tētahi rā

explanations.explanation: Indicates the time of an action.
Used to refer to a specific but unspecified thing.

notes.text: i rongo a Tama

explanations.explanation: Particle used to mark the subject of the verb.

notes.text: i te hononga hohonu ki a Maunga Nui
notes.translation: a deep connection to Maunga Nui

explanations.explanation: Indicates the object of the action.
Particle used to mark the subject of the verb.

notes.text: ā, i hiahia ia ki te rongo i tōna aroaro
notes.translation: and wanted to feel its presence

explanations.explanation: Indicates the object of the action.

sentences.maori: I whakatau ia ki te haere ki tētahi wāhi motuhake i te takere o te maunga, i reira ngā tāngata o te kāinga e haere ana ki te rapu tohutohu me te kaha.
sentences.english: He decided to go to a special place at the base of the mountain, where the villagers went to seek guidance and strength.

notes.text: I whakatau ia
ki te haere ki tētahi wāhi motuhake
notes.translation: to go to a special place

explanations.explanation: Used to refer to a specific but unspecified thing.

notes.text: i te takere o te maunga
notes.translation: at the base of the mountain

explanations.explanation: Indicates the place of an action.

notes.text: i reira ngā tāngata o te kāinga e haere ana ki te rapu tohutohu me te kaha
notes.translation: where the villagers went to seek guidance and strength

explanations.explanation: Indicates the place of an action.

sentences.maori: I a ia e hīkoi ana, i rongo a Tama i te aroaro o Maunga Nui huri noa i a ia.
sentences.english: As he walked, Tama felt the presence of Maunga Nui all around him.

notes.text: I a ia e hīkoi ana

explanations.explanation: Indicates the time of an action.

notes.text: i rongo a Tama

explanations.explanation: Particle used to mark the subject of the verb.

notes.text: i te aroaro o Maunga Nui

explanations.explanation: Indicates the object of the action.

notes.text: huri noa i a ia

explanations.explanation: Indicates the place of an action.

sentences.maori: Ko ngā kōhimuhimu o te hau e kawe ana i te māramatanga o te maunga, ā, ko ngā rau e ngangau ana e waiata ana i ngā waiata o ōna tūpuna.
sentences.english: The whispers of the wind carried the wisdom of the mountain, and the rustling leaves sang the songs of his ancestors.

notes.text: Ko ngā kōhimuhimu o te hau

explanations.explanation: Particle used to introduce a subject.

notes.text: e kawe ana i te māramatanga o te maunga
notes.translation: carried the wisdom of the mountain

explanations.explanation: Indicates the object of the action.

notes.text: ā, ko ngā rau e ngangau ana

explanations.explanation: Particle used to introduce a subject.

notes.text: e waiata ana i ngā waiata o ōna tūpuna
notes.translation: sang the songs of his ancestors

explanations.explanation: Indicates the object of the action.

sentences.maori: "He kaha koe, e Tama," te kī a te maunga. "Kei roto i a koe te wairua o ō tūpuna."
sentences.english: "You are strong, Tama," said the mountain. "Within you is the spirit of your ancestors."

notes.text: "He kaha koe, e Tama,"

explanations.explanation: Vocative particle used to address someone directly, followed by the name 'Tama.'

notes.text: te kī a te maunga

explanations.explanation: Particle used to mark the subject of the verb.

notes.text: "Kei roto i a koe te wairua o ō tūpuna."
notes.translation: "Within you is the spirit of your ancestors."

sentences.maori: Ehara i te mea māmā te haerenga a Tama.
sentences.english: Tama's journey was not easy.

notes.text: Ehara i te mea māmā
te haerenga a Tama

sentences.maori: I tūtaki ia ki ngā ara pari me ngā ngahere kerekere.
sentences.english: He encountered steep paths and dense forests.

notes.text: I tūtaki ia
ki ngā ara pari
me ngā ngahere kerekere

sentences.maori: Engari i ngā wā katoa i ngenge ai, i mataku ai ia, ka maumahara ia ki te kaha o Maunga Nui.
sentences.english: But whenever he felt tired or afraid, he remembered the strength of Maunga Nui.

notes.text: Engari i ngā wā katoa

explanations.explanation: Indicates the time of an action.

notes.text: i ngenge ai, i mataku ai ia

explanations.explanation: Particle used to indicate a habitual action.
Particle used to indicate a habitual action.

notes.text: ka maumahara ia ki te kaha o Maunga Nui
notes.translation: he remembered the strength of Maunga Nui

explanations.explanation: Indicates a future or habitual action.

sentences.maori: Me te māia hou, ka haere tonu ia, e mōhio ana kei te tiaki tōna tupuna i a ia.
sentences.english: With new courage, he continued, knowing that his ancestor was watching over him.

notes.text: Me te māia hou
ka haere tonu ia

explanations.explanation: Indicates a future or habitual action.

notes.text: e mōhio ana kei te tiaki tōna tupuna i a ia
notes.translation: knowing that his ancestor was watching over him

sentences.maori: Ka mutu, ka tae a Tama ki te wāhi tapu i te takere o Maunga Nui.
sentences.english: Finally, Tama reached the sacred place at the base of Maunga Nui.

notes.text: Ka mutu

explanations.explanation: Indicates a future or habitual action.

notes.text: ka tae a Tama

explanations.explanation: Indicates a future or habitual action.
Particle used to mark the subject of the verb.

notes.text: ki te wāhi tapu i te takere o Maunga Nui
notes.translation: the sacred place at the base of Maunga Nui

explanations.explanation: Indicates the place of an action.

sentences.maori: Ka noho ia, ka kati ōna karu, ka rongo i te aroaro o te maunga e awhi ana i a ia.
sentences.english: He sat, closed his eyes, and felt the presence of the mountain embracing him.

notes.text: Ka noho ia

explanations.explanation: Indicates a future or habitual action.

notes.text: ka kati ōna karu

explanations.explanation: Indicates a future or habitual action.

notes.text: ka rongo i te aroaro o te maunga
notes.translation: felt the presence of the mountain

explanations.explanation: Indicates a future or habitual action.
Indicates the object of the action.

notes.text: e awhi ana i a ia

explanations.explanation: Indicates the object of the action.

sentences.maori: "Ngā mihi, e Maunga Nui, mō te hoatu i te kaha ki a au," te kī a Tama.
sentences.english: "Thank you, Maunga Nui, for giving me strength," said Tama.

notes.text: "Ngā mihi, e Maunga Nui, mō te hoatu i te kaha ki a au,"
notes.translation: "Thank you, Maunga Nui, for giving me strength,"

explanations.explanation: Vocative particle used to address someone directly, followed by the name 'Maunga Nui.'

notes.text: te kī a Tama

explanations.explanation: Particle used to mark the subject of the verb.

sentences.maori: I taua wā tonu, ka rongo ia i tētahi hau mahana, me te mea e awhi ana te maunga i a ia me te aroha me te whakahīhī.
sentences.english: At that moment, he felt a warm breeze, as if the mountain was embracing him with love and pride.

notes.text: I taua wā tonu

explanations.explanation: Indicates the time of an action.

notes.text: ka rongo ia

explanations.explanation: Indicates a future or habitual action.

notes.text: i tētahi hau mahana

explanations.explanation: Indicates the object of the action.
Used to refer to a specific but unspecified thing.

notes.text: me te mea e awhi ana te maunga i a ia
notes.translation: as if the mountain was embracing him

explanations.explanation: Indicates the object of the action.

notes.text: me te aroha me te whakahīhī

sentences.maori: Mai i taua rā, i mōhio a Tama ahakoa te wāhi e haere ai ia, ahakoa ngā wero e tūtaki ai ia, ka mau tonu ia i te kaha o Maunga Nui i roto i a ia.
sentences.english: From that day, Tama knew that no matter where he went, no matter the challenges he faced, he would always carry the strength of Maunga Nui within him.

notes.text: Mai i taua rā
i mōhio a Tama

explanations.explanation: Particle used to mark the subject of the verb.

notes.text: ahakoa te wāhi e haere ai ia
ahakoa ngā wero e tūtaki ai ia
notes.translation: no matter the challenges he faced

notes.text: ka mau tonu ia i te kaha o Maunga Nui i roto i a ia
notes.translation: he would always carry the strength of Maunga Nui within him

explanations.explanation: Indicates a future or habitual action.
Indicates the object of the action.

sentences.maori: Ā, i ngā wā katoa ka titiro ia ki te maunga, ka maumahara ia ki te haerenga i whakatata atu ai ia ki tōna tupuna.
sentences.english: And, whenever he looked at the mountain, he remembered the journey that brought him closer to his ancestor.

notes.text: Ā, i ngā wā katoa

explanations.explanation: Indicates the time of an action.

notes.text: ka titiro ia ki te maunga

explanations.explanation: Indicates a future or habitual action.

explanations.explanation: Indicates a future or habitual action.

notes.text: i whakatata atu ai ia ki tōna tupuna
notes.translation: that brought him closer to his ancestor

explanations.explanation: Particle used to indicate a habitual action.

sentences.maori: I tētahi rā, ka kai a Tama i te aihikirīmi maha rawa.
sentences.english: One day, Tama ate too much ice cream.

notes.text: I tētahi rā

explanations.explanation: Indicates the time of an action.
Used to refer to a specific but unspecified thing.

notes.text: ka kai a Tama

explanations.explanation: Indicates a future or habitual action, but can also be used to narrate past events in a storytelling context.
Particle used to mark the subject of the verb.

notes.text: i te aihikirīmi maha rawa

explanations.explanation: Indicates the object of the action.
Adverb meaning 'too much,' emphasizing the extent.

sentences.maori: I te tuatahi, i tino harikoa ia.
sentences.english: At first, he was very happy.

notes.text: I te tuatahi

explanations.explanation: Indicates the time of an action.

notes.text: i tino harikoa ia

sentences.maori: Engari, kāore i roa, ka tīmata tana puku ki te mamae.
sentences.english: But soon, his stomach started to hurt.

notes.text: Engari

explanations.explanation: Conjunction used to introduce a contrast.

notes.text: kāore i roa

explanations.explanation: Indicates the time of an action.

notes.text: ka tīmata tana puku ki te mamae

explanations.explanation: Indicates a future or habitual action, but can also be used to narrate past events in a storytelling context.

sentences.maori: I te mutunga, kāore ia i taea te tākaro ki ōna hoa.
sentences.english: In the end, he couldn't play with his friends.

notes.text: I te mutunga

explanations.explanation: Indicates the time of an action.

notes.text: kāore ia i taea te tākaro ki ōna hoa
notes.translation: he couldn't play with his friends

sentences.maori: I te kāinga, i moe a Tama i runga i te moenga.
sentences.english: At home, Tama lay down on his bed.

explanations.explanation: Indicates the place of an action.

notes.text: i moe a Tama

explanations.explanation: Verb meaning 'to sleep' or 'to lie down.'
Particle used to mark the subject of the verb.

notes.text: i runga i te moenga

explanations.explanation: Indicates the place of an action.

sentences.maori: I ako ia i tētahi akoranga nui.
sentences.english: He learned an important lesson.

notes.text: I ako ia
i tētahi akoranga nui

explanations.explanation: Indicates the object of the action.

sentences.maori: Kaua rawa e kai i te aihikirīmi maha rawa.
sentences.english: Never eat too much ice cream.

explanations.explanation: Particle used to indicate an imperative.

notes.text: i te aihikirīmi maha rawa

explanations.explanation: Indicates the object of the action.
Adverb meaning 'too much,' emphasizing the extent.

sentences.maori: I tētahi rā, i haere a Tama ki te ngahere.
sentences.english: One day, Tama went to the forest.

notes.text: I tētahi rā

explanations.explanation: Indicates the time of an action.
Used to refer to a specific but unspecified thing.

notes.text: i haere a Tama ki te ngahere

sentences.maori: I kite ia i tētahi rākau Kauri nui.
sentences.english: He saw a large Kauri tree.

notes.text: I kite ia
i tētahi rākau Kauri nui

explanations.explanation: Used to refer to a specific but unspecified thing.

sentences.maori: I ako ia mō te hiranga o te rākau Kauri ki te ahurea Māori.
sentences.english: He learned about the significance of the Kauri tree to Māori culture.

notes.text: I ako ia
mō te hiranga o te rākau Kauri ki te ahurea Māori
notes.translation: about the significance of the Kauri tree to Māori culture

explanations.explanation: Noun phrase meaning 'of the Kauri tree.'

sentences.maori: I rongo ia i te kōrero mō te tapu o te rākau.
sentences.english: He heard stories about the sacredness of the tree.

notes.text: I rongo ia
i te kōrero mō te tapu o te rākau
notes.translation: stories about the sacredness of the tree

sentences.maori: I te wā i hoki ai ia ki te kāinga, i kite ia i ngā tāngata e hiahia ana ki te tapahi i te rākau.
sentences.english: When he returned home, he saw people wanting to cut down the tree.

notes.text: I te wā i hoki ai ia ki te kāinga

explanations.explanation: Indicates the time of an action.

notes.text: i kite ia i ngā tāngata e hiahia ana ki te tapahi i te rākau

sentences.maori: I whakatau a Tama ki te tiaki i te rākau.
sentences.english: Tama decided to protect the tree.

notes.text: I whakatau a Tama
ki te tiaki i te rākau

sentences.maori: I karanga ia ki tōna hapori mō te āwhina.
sentences.english: He called his community for help.

notes.text: I karanga ia
ki tōna hapori mō te āwhina

sentences.maori: I huihui te hapori ki te tiaki i te rākau Kauri.
sentences.english: The community gathered to protect the Kauri tree.

notes.text: I huihui te hapori
ki te tiaki i te rākau Kauri

sentences.maori: I ako rātou mō te hiranga o te tiaki i te taiao.
sentences.english: They learned about the importance of environmental conservation.

notes.text: I ako rātou
mō te hiranga o te tiaki i te taiao
notes.translation: about the importance of environmental conservation

sentences.maori: I te mutunga, i tiakina te rākau Kauri, ā, i noho tonu te rākau hei tohu o te ahurea Māori.
sentences.english: In the end, the Kauri tree was protected, and it remained a symbol of Māori culture.

notes.text: I te mutunga

explanations.explanation: Indicates the time of an action.

notes.translation: and it remained a symbol of Māori culture

explanations.explanation: Prepositional phrase meaning 'a symbol of Māori culture.'

sentences.maori: I whakanuia e te hapori te angitu o rātou mahi.
sentences.english: The community celebrated their success.

notes.text: I whakanuia e te hapori
te angitu o rātou mahi

sentences.maori: I ako a Tama me tōna hapori he mea nui te tiaki i ngā taonga tuku iho.
